messages.message:
@mfichman I am working on some updates which require changes to mount service and ingestion service protos. I noticed that when I generate protobuf files using `go generate instabase/protos/...`, they update many other protos (e.g. ai_hub_fields.pb.go, audit_logs.pb.go, and 6 others) in addition to mount and ingestion services.

Is this because of recent `go/makefile/bazel` changes or is this because people have just not generated code for their proto changes (hard to believe given the number of files)? I want to keep my changes minimal for now and only generate mount service and ingestion service -- is there a way to do this?

Cursor suggests something like this (for mount service):
```cd /home/owner/instabase/shared-utils/go-utils/src/instabase/protos && protoc --go_out=../.. --go-grpc_out=../.. --grpc-gateway_out=../.. --proto_path=../../../../protos ../../../../protos/instabase/protos/mount_service/mount_service.proto```

This is because we are still on Bazel, technically speaking. People are not forced to run Go generate yet, so they don’t. I’ve been running it periodically, but it’s likely behind as people make edits to the proto all the time. This will change soon!!
Do not manually run protoc; use go generate
